Sentencas: The effect of the incorporation of oxides (CeO2, CaO, MgO, SrO, BaO) into SOFC anodes on sulfur poisoning of Ni catalysts is investigated by means of a comprehensive thermodynamic study.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that sulfur chemical potential controls the value of bulk nickel sulfide activity, which, in turn, is a function of sulfur coverage on Ni surface.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: It is found that oxide incorporation into anodes can reduce the sulfur chemisorption on Ni by lowering the sulfur chemical potential.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: BaO incorporation may be the best option for IT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: The strong affinity of BaO towards sulfur significantly reduces the sulfur coverage on Ni surface, from values in the range of 0.91-0.96 to 0.54-0.58, for wet hydrogen atmosphere, in such a way that catalyst poisoning can be completely prevented.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: In situ regeneration of BaO could occur by means of a local reaction between BaS and OH species that are generated by dissociative chemisorption of H2O. The highest H2S concentration allowed in a BaO-modified anode depends on fuel composition: 100 ppm for wet hydrogen (3%H2O), and 30-45 ppm for biogas, varying according to CH4/CO2 molar ratio.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: In the case of biogas, enhanced sulfur tolerance can be achieved provided that the BaCO3 phase cannot be formed.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: For modified and unmodified anodes, the degree of sulfur poisoning was found to decrease with increasing CH4/CO2 molar ratio in biogas.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: Although ceria can effectively suppress carbon deposition due to oxygen storage capacity, it cannot alleviate sulfur poisoning of Ni under carbon-free conditions.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study

Sentencas: At carbon deposition boundary, ceria increases the tolerance toward H2S in the biogas only modestly.
Titulo: Oxide incorporation into Ni-based solid oxide fuel cell anodes for enhanced sulfur tolerance during operation on hydrogen or biogas fuels: A comprehensive thermodynamic study
